dcterms:description: A database covering 10 most widespread Chinese dialects, including Ningxia, Hefei, Sichuan, Shanxi, Changsha, Hebei, Nanchang, Shanghai, Kekka, and Fujian. Each dialect has 6-hour audio data, with 6000 audio files in each dialect for training and 500 audio files for testing, categorized by audio duration.
dcterms:title: Chinese Dialect Database

dcterms:description: A challenge focused on recognizing Chinese dialects, where the authors' system won first place among 110 teams. The challenge likely involves various dialects and requires accurate classification of dialect categories.
dcterms:title: Xunfei (iFlyTek) Chinese Dialect Recognition Challenge

dcterms:creator: A. Graves
S. Fern√°ndez
F. Gomez
J. Schmidhuber
dcterms:description: A method for labeling unsegmented sequence data using recurrent neural networks, which is utilized for phonetic sequence annotation in the authors' acoustic model.
dcterms:title: Phonetic Sequence Annotation
